title: Can i get banned for this.
body:
I play Jungle.

If you are a laner and you die 1 v 1 and you buy damage instead of getting a defensive item and farming safely. 
I tell them i am not coming to your lane and i start farming. 
I do the same to the idiot that pushes waves high without vision and gets ganked. 

I then start powerfarming to the game ends. 
I prefer to lose LP than to give these laners any LP.

replies.body:
>If you are a laner and you die 1 v 1 and you buy damage instead of getting a defensive item and farming safely.
I tell them i am not coming to your lane and i start farming.
I do the same to the idiot that pushes waves high without vision and gets ganked. 

While really not a great attitude to have, strictly gameplay-wise there is an argument for putting the effort into augmenting winning lanes instead of trying to salvage lost ones.

>I then start powerfarming to the game ends.
I prefer to lose LP than to give these laners any LP.

This, on the other hand, is intentionally losing a game, and therefore ban-worthy.

No-one expects you be some perfect saint, but in the same manner it is hypocritical to assume others should be without faults as well. Intentionally losing a game as revenge for someone not playing to what sounds like an unreasonable standard that you as a random stranger on the internet has set 110% classifies as negative behaviour and can get you punished.

Also, not a great way to climb, given that teamwork is just as important as any other skill in this *team* game, and that mistakes aren't made to spite some random player they'll probably never see again, but rather, the vast majority of the time are simply that: mistakes. Mistakes can be salvaged, negativity sets the tone for the rest of the game and just tilts people.
